required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Substudy - Low Dose of Abatacept in Subjects With Rheumatoid Arthritis
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3B, Multi-Center, Randomized, Double-blind Study to Evaluate Remission and Joint Damage Progression in Methotrexate-naïve Early Erosive Rheumatoid Arthritis Subjects Treated With Abatacept Plus Methotrexate Compared With Methotrexate - Low Dose Sub-Study

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this exploratory sub-study was to evaluate from a clinical perspective the impact on disease activity of lowering the dose of abatacept from 10 mg/kg to 5 mg/kg in subjects who had achieved remission (Disease Activity Score 28 [DAS 28]-erythrocyte sedimentation rate [ESR] < 2.6) at Day 701 of study IM101023.

primary_outcome.measure: Time to Disease Relapse Through Month 12 (Kaplan-Meier Cumulative Percentage of Events of Disease Relapse)
primary_outcome.description: An event of disease relapse was defined as additional Disease-modifying antirheumatic drug (DMARD) therapy given, or 2 or more courses of high steroids given, or return to abatacept 10 mg/kg (rescue medication given), or DAS28 C-reactive protein (CRP) score >=3.2 at 2 consecutive visits. Time to disease relapse was evaluated using life tables (Kaplan-Meier Cumulative Percentage of Events of Disease Relapse).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Experiencing Disease Relapse
secondary_outcome.description: Disease relapse is defined as additional DMARD therapy given, or 2 or more courses of high steroids given, or return to abatacept 10 mg/kg (rescue medication given), or DAS28 CRP score >= 3.2 at 2 consecutive visits.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Time-Matched Baseline DAS28 CRP Scores
secondary_outcome.description: Mean baseline DAS28 CRP values for the cohort of participants with serum samples available at that timepoint. DAS 28 is a continuous variable which is a composite of 4 variables: number of tender joints out of 28, number of swollen joints out of 28 joints, CRP in mg/L and subject assessment of disease activity measure on a visual analogue scale (VAS) of 100 mm. The DAS28 provides a score on a scale from 0 to 10 indicating the current activity of the rheumatoid arthritis (>5.1=high disease activity; <3.2=low disease activity; <2.6=remission).

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in DAS28 CRP During Double-Blind Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Mean baseline DAS28 CRP values for the cohort of participants with serum samples available at that timepoint. DAS 28 is a continuous variable which is a composite of 4 variables: number of tender joints out of 28, number of swollen joints out of 28 joints, CRP in mg/L and subject assessment of disease activity measure on a VAS of 100 mm. The DAS28 provides a score on a scale from 0 to 10 indicating the current activity of the rheumatoid arthritis (>5.1=high disease activity; <3.2=low disease activity; <2.6=remission).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With 2 Consecutive DAS 28 CRP Scores ≥ 3.2 (Loss of Low Disease Activity Status)
secondary_outcome.description: DAS 28 is a continuous variable which is a composite of 4 variables: number of tender joints out of 28, number of swollen joints out of 28 joints, CRP in mg/L and subject assessment of disease activity measure on a VAS of 100 mm. The DAS28 provides a score on a scale from 0 to 10 indicating the current activity of the rheumatoid arthritis (>5.1=high disease activity; <3.2=low disease activity; <2.6=remission).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Given Additional DMARD Therapy During Double-Blind Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Additional DMARD therapy is defined as a re-introduction of methotrexate (MTX), an increase of at least 2.5 mg of MTX, or the addition of at least 1 DMARD.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who at Any Time During Double-Blind Treatment Were Given 2 or More Courses of High-Dose Steroids
secondary_outcome.description: A course of high dose steroids is defined as a course of intramuscular, intravenous, or high dose oral corticosteroids (use of > 10 mg/day equivalent of prednisone for a minimum of 3 consecutive days or for those subjects who had continued use for long durations of time, each course was determined by 28 day intervals).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Given Rescue Medication Therapy During Double-Blind Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: All subjects in the sub-study randomized to receive double-blind abatacept 5 mg/kg or 10 mg/kg. Subjects rescued to open-label treatment received abatacept 10 mg/kg.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Modified Therapy During Double-Blind Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Modified therapy=additional DMARD therapy, 2 or more courses of high dose steroids or rescue medication. Additional DMARD therapy=re-introduction of methotrexate (MTX), an increase of at least 2.5 mg of MTX, or the addition of at least 1 DMARD. A course of high dose steroids=a course of intramuscular, intravenous, or high dose oral corticosteroids (use of > 10 mg/day equivalent of prednisone for a minimum of 3 consecutive days or for those subjects who had continued use for long durations of time, each course was determined by 28 day intervals). Rescue medication=abatacept 10 mg/kg.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Lost Remission Status
secondary_outcome.description: Loss of remission is defined as DAS 28 CRP >=2.6.

secondary_outcome.measure: Steady-state Trough Serum Concentration (Cmin) of Abatacept During Double-Blind Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 701 of the main study; sub-study Days 1, 85, 169, 253

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs), Serious AEs (SAEs), Deaths, and Discontinuations During Double-Blind Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of substudy up to 56 days post last dose in the double-blind period or start of the open-label rescue period, whichever occurred first until end of study (study duration was 115 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: AE=any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition in a subject administered an investigational product and that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. Related AE/SAE=Certain, Probable, Possible, or Missing. SAE=any untoward medical occurrence that results in death, is life-threatening, requires or prolongs inpatient hospitalization (including elective surgery), results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, or is an important medical event.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Infection and Infestation AEs Reported During Double-Blind Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of substudy up to 56 days post last dose in the double-blind period or start of the open-label rescue period, whichever occurred first until end of study (study duration was 115 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: AE=any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition in a subject administered an investigational product and that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. Infection and Infestation AEs = any AE within the System Organ Class Infection and Infestation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Malignant Neoplasms Reported During Double-Blind Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of substudy up to 56 days post last dose in the double-blind period or start of the open-label rescue period, whichever occurred first until end of study (study duration was 115 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: All neoplasms were assessed by medical review as to whether or not the event was malignant.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Prespecified Acute Infusional Adverse Events (AIAEs) During Double-Blind Treatment, by Intensity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of substudy up to 56 days post last dose in the double-blind period or start of the open-label rescue period, whichever occurred first until end of study (study duration was 115 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: AE=any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition in a subject administered an investigational product and that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. Acute Infusional AE= a subset of the peri-infusional AEs with onset during the first hour after the start of the study drug infusion. A total of 105 infusional events were prespecified in the protocol.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Prespecified Peri-Infusional Adverse Events (PAIAEs) During Double-Blind Treatment, by Intensity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of substudy up to 56 days post last dose in the double-blind period or start of the open-label rescue period, whichever occurred first until end of study (study duration was 115 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: AE=any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition in a subject administered an investigational product and that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. Peri-infusional AE=a pre-specified infusional AE occuring during the first 24 hours after the start of study drug infusion.A total of 105 infusional events were prespecified in the protocol. GDASC=General Disorders and Administration Site Conditions, RTMD=Respiratory, Thoracic and Mediastinal Disorders.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Pre-specified Autoimmune Disorders (ADs) Reported During Double-Blind Treatment, by Intensity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of substudy up to 56 days post last dose in the double-blind period or start of the open-label rescue period, whichever occurred first until end of study (study duration was 115 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: A total of 127 autoimmune disorders were prespecified in the protocol. MCTD=Musculoskeletal and Connective Tissue Disorders

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Laboratory Values Meeting the Marked Abnormality Criteria During Double-Blind Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of substudy up to 56 days post last dose in the double-blind period or start of the open-label rescue period, whichever occurred first until end of study (study duration was 115 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Not evaluated: high hemoglobin,high hematocrit,high erythrocytes,high neutrophils+bands(N+B),low monocytes,low basophils,low eosinophils,low alkaline phosphatase(ALP),low aspartate aminotransferase(AST),low alanine aminotransferase(ALT),low G-Glutamyl transferase(GGT),low total bilirubin,low blood urea nitrogen,low creatinine,high albumin,low uric acid,low urine protein,low urine glucose,low urine blood,low urine leukocyte esterase,low urine white blood cells,low red blood cells.Pre Rx=pretreatment,(*)Lymphocytes(c/uL):Low<.750x10^3,High>7.50x10^3.(*)Eosinophils:>.750x10^3 c/uL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinically Significant Changes in Vital Signs and Physical Findings
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of substudy up to 56 days post last dose in the double-blind period or start of the open-label rescue period, whichever occurred first until end of study (study duration was 115 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical significance was determined by investigator. Parameters include blood pressure, heart rate, respiration rate, and temperature.

secondary_outcome.measure: Participants With Positive Antibody Responses to Abatacept (Electrochemiluminescence [ECL] Method) During Double-Blind Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: A positive antibody response to Abatacept (measured by the ECL assay) is further classified as a positive response for either Cytotoxic T-Lymphocyte Antigen 4 (CTLA4) and Possibly immunoglobulin (Ig)' or 'Ig and/or Junction Region'

intervention.description: IV solution, IV, 10 mg/Kg, Once monthly, 1 year
IV solution, IV, 5 mg/Kg, Once monthly, 1 year

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who have completed the main study, are willing to participate and have a DAS 28 ESR score of < 2.6 on Day 701 of the main study
Exclusion Criteria:

link.description: For FDA Safety Alerts and Recalls refer to the following link www.fda.gov/MEDWATCH/safety.htm

participant_flow.recruitment_details: IM101023 (NCT00122382) was a 2-year study completing on Day 729, in which subjects were randomized to receive abatacept or placebo in combination with methotrexate (MTX) for the 1st year of the study and were then switched to open-label abatacept+MTX in the 2nd year. All subjects had received abatacept for a least 1 year prior start of sub-study.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Of the 433 participants who completed the main study (IM101-023 NCT00122382), 108 enrolled in the sub-study.

group.title: Abatacept (10 mg/kg)
group.description: All subjects in the sub-study randomized to receive double-blind abatacept 10 mg/kg. Subjects rescued to open-label treatment received abatacept 10 mg/kg. The length of the sub-study is 1 year. As such, the maximum time the subject is treated collectively in double-blind and open-label treatment is 1 year.

group.title: Abatacept (5 mg/kg)
group.description: All subjects in the sub-study randomized to receive double-blind abatacept 5 mg/kg. Subjects rescued to open-label treatment received abatacept 10 mg/kg. The length of the sub-study is 1 year. As such, the maximum time the subject is treated collectively in double-blind and open-label treatment is 1 year.

participants_list.participants: Of these, 1 was discontinued from open-label treatment (lost to follow-up).

group.title: Abatacept (10 mg/kg)
group.description: All participants in the sub-study randomized to receive double-blind abatacept 10 mg/kg

group.title: Abatacept (5 mg/kg)
group.description: All participants in the sub-study randomized to receive double-blind abatacept 5 mg/kg

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
Gender
Race/Ethnicity, Customized
Weight
measure.description: One participant in the 10 mg/kg group did not have weight reported.

measure.title: Disease Activity Scores Using C-reactive Protein (DAS 28 [CRP])
measure.description: The DAS28 provides a score on a scale from 0 to 10 indicating the current activity of the rheumatoid arthritis (>5.1=high disease activity; <3.2=low disease activity; <2.6=remission).DAS 28 is a continuous variable which is a composite of 4 variables: the number of tender joints out of 28, the number of swollen joints out of 28 joints, C-reactive protein in mg/L (CRP) and subject assessment of disease activity measure on a visual analogue scale (VAS) of 100 mm based on the following formula: DAS 28 = 0.56*sqrt(TJC28) + 0.28*sqrt(SJC28) + 0.36*ln(CRP+1) + 0.014*GH + 0.96.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Experiencing Disease Relapse
outcome.description: Disease relapse is defined as additional DMARD therapy given, or 2 or more courses of high steroids given, or return to abatacept 10 mg/kg (rescue medication given), or DAS28 CRP score >= 3.2 at 2 consecutive visits.
outcome.population: Number of participants analyzed=number randomized.

outcome.title: Mean Time-Matched Baseline DAS28 CRP Scores
outcome.description: Mean baseline DAS28 CRP values for the cohort of participants with serum samples available at that timepoint. DAS 28 is a continuous variable which is a composite of 4 variables: number of tender joints out of 28, number of swollen joints out of 28 joints, CRP in mg/L and subject assessment of disease activity measure on a visual analogue scale (VAS) of 100 mm. The DAS28 provides a score on a scale from 0 to 10 indicating the current activity of the rheumatoid arthritis (>5.1=high disease activity; <3.2=low disease activity; <2.6=remission).
outcome.population: Number of participants analyzed=number of participants randomized; n=All treated participants with available DAS28 CRP scores at that time point. Mean time-matched baseline values reflect changing n-values over time.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs), Serious AEs (SAEs), Deaths, and Discontinuations During Double-Blind Treatment
measure.description: AE=any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition in a subject administered an investigational product and that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. Related AE/SAE=Certain, Probable, Possible, or Missing. SAE=any untoward medical occurrence that results in death, is life-threatening, requires or prolongs inpatient hospitalization (including elective surgery), results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, or is an important medical event.
measure.population: Number of participants analyzed = All treated participants during the double-blind period.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Infection and Infestation AEs Reported During Double-Blind Treatment
outcome.description: AE=any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition in a subject administered an investigational product and that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. Infection and Infestation AEs = any AE within the System Organ Class Infection and Infestation.
outcome.time_frame: From start of substudy up to 56 days post last dose in the double-blind period or start of the open-label rescue period, whichever occurred first until end of study (study duration was 115 weeks)
outcome.population: Number of participants analyzed = All treated participants during the double-blind period.

measure.description: AE=any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition in a subject administered an investigational product and that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. Infection and Infestation AEs = any AE within the System Organ Class Infection and Infestation.
measure.population: Number of participants analyzed = All treated participants during the double-blind period.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Malignant Neoplasms Reported During Double-Blind Treatment
outcome.description: All neoplasms were assessed by medical review as to whether or not the event was malignant.
outcome.time_frame: From start of substudy up to 56 days post last dose in the double-blind period or start of the open-label rescue period, whichever occurred first until end of study (study duration was 115 weeks)
outcome.population: Number of participants analyzed = All treated participants during the double-blind period.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Malignant Neoplasms Reported During Double-Blind Treatment
measure.description: All neoplasms were assessed by medical review as to whether or not the event was malignant.
measure.population: Number of participants analyzed = All treated participants during the double-blind period.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Prespecified Acute Infusional Adverse Events (AIAEs) During Double-Blind Treatment, by Intensity
outcome.description: AE=any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition in a subject administered an investigational product and that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. Acute Infusional AE= a subset of the peri-infusional AEs with onset during the first hour after the start of the study drug infusion. A total of 105 infusional events were prespecified in the protocol.
outcome.time_frame: From start of substudy up to 56 days post last dose in the double-blind period or start of the open-label rescue period, whichever occurred first until end of study (study duration was 115 weeks)
outcome.population: Number of participants analyzed = All treated participants during the double-blind period.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Prespecified Acute Infusional Adverse Events (AIAEs) During Double-Blind Treatment, by Intensity
measure.description: AE=any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition in a subject administered an investigational product and that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. Acute Infusional AE= a subset of the peri-infusional AEs with onset during the first hour after the start of the study drug infusion. A total of 105 infusional events were prespecified in the protocol.
measure.population: Number of participants analyzed = All treated participants during the double-blind period.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Prespecified Peri-Infusional Adverse Events (PAIAEs) During Double-Blind Treatment, by Intensity
outcome.description: AE=any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition in a subject administered an investigational product and that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. Peri-infusional AE=a pre-specified infusional AE occuring during the first 24 hours after the start of study drug infusion.A total of 105 infusional events were prespecified in the protocol. GDASC=General Disorders and Administration Site Conditions, RTMD=Respiratory, Thoracic and Mediastinal Disorders.
outcome.time_frame: From start of substudy up to 56 days post last dose in the double-blind period or start of the open-label rescue period, whichever occurred first until end of study (study duration was 115 weeks)
outcome.population: Number of participants analyzed = All treated participants during the double-blind period.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Prespecified Peri-Infusional Adverse Events (PAIAEs) During Double-Blind Treatment, by Intensity
measure.description: AE=any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition in a subject administered an investigational product and that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. Peri-infusional AE=a pre-specified infusional AE occuring during the first 24 hours after the start of study drug infusion.A total of 105 infusional events were prespecified in the protocol. GDASC=General Disorders and Administration Site Conditions, RTMD=Respiratory, Thoracic and Mediastinal Disorders.
measure.population: Number of participants analyzed = All treated participants during the double-blind period.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Pre-specified Autoimmune Disorders (ADs) Reported During Double-Blind Treatment, by Intensity
outcome.description: A total of 127 autoimmune disorders were prespecified in the protocol. MCTD=Musculoskeletal and Connective Tissue Disorders
outcome.time_frame: From start of substudy up to 56 days post last dose in the double-blind period or start of the open-label rescue period, whichever occurred first until end of study (study duration was 115 weeks)
outcome.population: Number of participants analyzed = All treated participants during the double-blind period.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Laboratory Values Meeting the Marked Abnormality Criteria During Double-Blind Treatment
outcome.description: Not evaluated: high hemoglobin,high hematocrit,high erythrocytes,high neutrophils+bands(N+B),low monocytes,low basophils,low eosinophils,low alkaline phosphatase(ALP),low aspartate aminotransferase(AST),low alanine aminotransferase(ALT),low G-Glutamyl transferase(GGT),low total bilirubin,low blood urea nitrogen,low creatinine,high albumin,low uric acid,low urine protein,low urine glucose,low urine blood,low urine leukocyte esterase,low urine white blood cells,low red blood cells.Pre Rx=pretreatment,(*)Lymphocytes(c/uL):Low<.750x10^3,High>7.50x10^3.(*)Eosinophils:>.750x10^3 c/uL.
outcome.time_frame: From start of substudy up to 56 days post last dose in the double-blind period or start of the open-label rescue period, whichever occurred first until end of study (study duration was 115 weeks)
outcome.population: Number of participants analyzed = All treated participants during the double-blind period; n=number of participants with specific measure

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Laboratory Values Meeting the Marked Abnormality Criteria During Double-Blind Treatment
measure.description: Not evaluated: high hemoglobin,high hematocrit,high erythrocytes,high neutrophils+bands(N+B),low monocytes,low basophils,low eosinophils,low alkaline phosphatase(ALP),low aspartate aminotransferase(AST),low alanine aminotransferase(ALT),low G-Glutamyl transferase(GGT),low total bilirubin,low blood urea nitrogen,low creatinine,high albumin,low uric acid,low urine protein,low urine glucose,low urine blood,low urine leukocyte esterase,low urine white blood cells,low red blood cells.Pre Rx=pretreatment,(*)Lymphocytes(c/uL):Low<.750x10^3,High>7.50x10^3.(*)Eosinophils:>.750x10^3 c/uL.
measure.population: Number of participants analyzed = All treated participants during the double-blind period; n=number of participants with specific measure

class.title: Hemoglobin, Low: >3 g/dL ↓ from pre rx (n=51, 48)
ALP, High: >2 x upper limit normal (ULN)(n=52, 47)
Total Calcium, Low: <0.8 x Lower LN(LLN)(n=52, 47)
Blood Urea Nitrogen, High: >2 x pre rx (n=52, 47)

outcome.title: Clinically Significant Changes in Vital Signs and Physical Findings
outcome.description: Clinical significance was determined by investigator. Parameters include blood pressure, heart rate, respiration rate, and temperature.
outcome.time_frame: From start of substudy up to 56 days post last dose in the double-blind period or start of the open-label rescue period, whichever occurred first until end of study (study duration was 115 weeks)
outcome.population: This analysis was not done because clinically significant changes in vital signs and physical findings were reported as adverse events.

group.title: Abatacept (10 mg/kg)
group.description: All participants in the sub-study treated with double-blind abatacept 10 mg/kg

group.title: Abatacept (5 mg/kg)

measure.title: Clinically Significant Changes in Vital Signs and Physical Findings
measure.description: Clinical significance was determined by investigator. Parameters include blood pressure, heart rate, respiration rate, and temperature.
measure.population: This analysis was not done because clinically significant changes in vital signs and physical findings were reported as adverse events.

outcome.title: Participants With Positive Antibody Responses to Abatacept (Electrochemiluminescence [ECL] Method) During Double-Blind Treatment
outcome.description: A positive antibody response to Abatacept (measured by the ECL assay) is further classified as a positive response for either Cytotoxic T-Lymphocyte Antigen 4 (CTLA4) and Possibly immunoglobulin (Ig)' or 'Ig and/or Junction Region'
outcome.population: Number of participants analyzed= Number of participants with available immunogenicity measurements

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period ≤60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication.
